title: Guardians of the Galaxy Vol. 2
writer: James Gunn, Dan Abnett (based on the Marvel comics by), Andy Lanning (based on the Marvel comics by), Steve Englehart (Star-lord created by), Steve Gan (Star-lord created by), Jim Starlin (Gamora and Drax created by), Stan Lee (Groot created by), Larry Lieber (Groot created by), Jack Kirby (Groot created by), Bill Mantlo (Rocket Raccoon created by), Keith Giffen (Rocket Raccoon created by), Steve Gerber (Howard the Duck created by), Val Mayerik (Howard the Duck created by)
actors: Chris Pratt, Zoe Saldana, Dave Bautista, Vin Diesel
plot: The Guardians must fight to keep their newfound family together as they unravel the mystery of Peter Quill's true parentage.
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 12 wins & 42 nominations.

title: Avengers: Infinity War
writer: Christopher Markus (screenplay by), Stephen McFeely (screenplay by), Stan Lee (based on the Marvel comics by), Jack Kirby (based on the comics by), Joe Simon (Captain America created by), Jack Kirby (Captain America created by), Steve Englehart (Star-Lord created by), Steve Gan (Star-Lord created by), Bill Mantlo (Rocket Raccoon created by), Keith Giffen (Rocket Raccoon created by), Jim Starlin (Thanos,  Gamora and Drax created by), Stan Lee (Groot created by), Larry Lieber (Groot created by), Jack Kirby (Groot created by), Steve Englehart (Mantis created by), Don Heck (Mantis created by)
a: Robert Downey Jr., Chris Hemsworth, Mark Ruffalo, Chris Evans
plot: The Avengers and their allies must be willing to sacrifice all in an attempt to defeat the powerful Thanos before his blitz of devastation and ruin puts an end to the universe.

title: Captain Marvel
writer: Anna Boden (screenplay by), Gene Colan (based on the Marvel comics by), Liz Flahive (screenplay by), Ryan Fleck (screenplay by), Meg LeFauve (screenplay by), Carly Mensch (screenplay by), Nicole Perlman (screenplay by), Geneva Robertson-Dworet (screenplay by), Roy Thomas (based on the Marvel comics by)
a: Brie Larson, Ben Mendelsohn, Lee Pace, Samuel L. Jackson
plot: Carol Danvers becomes one of the universe's most powerful heroes when Earth is caught in the middle of a galactic war between two alien races.

title: Black Panther
writer: Ryan Coogler, Joe Robert Cole, Stan Lee (based on the Marvel Comics by), Jack Kirby (based on the Marvel Comics by)
a: Chadwick Boseman, Michael B. Jordan, Lupita Nyong'o, Danai Gurira
plot: T'Challa, the King of Wakanda, rises to the throne in the isolated, technologically advanced African nation, but his claim is challenged by a vengeful outsider who was a childhood victim of T'Challa's father's mistake.

title: A Quiet Place
writer: Bryan Woods (screenplay by), Scott Beck (screenplay by), John Krasinski (screenplay by), Bryan Woods (story by), Scott Beck (story by)
a: Emily Blunt, John Krasinski, Millicent Simmonds, Noah Jupe
plot: A family is forced to live in silence while hiding from creatures that hunt by sound.

title: The Greatest Showman
writer: Jenny Bicks (screenplay by), Bill Condon (screenplay by), Jenny Bicks (story by)
a: Hugh Jackman, Michelle Williams, Zac Efron, Zendaya
plot: Celebrates the birth of show business, and tells of a visionary who rose from nothing to create a spectacle that became a worldwide sensation.
awards: Nominated for 1 Oscar. Another 7 wins & 19 nominations.

title: Ready Player One
writer: Zak Penn (screenplay by), Ernest Cline (screenplay by), Ernest Cline (based on the novel by)
a: Tye Sheridan, Olivia Cooke, Ben Mendelsohn, Lena Waithe
plot: When the creator of a virtual reality world called the OASIS dies, he releases a video in which he challenges all OASIS users to find his Easter Egg, which will give the finder his fortune.
